t: Psalm 102
Affliction in light of Eternity
A prayer of a suffering person who is weak and pours out his lament before the Lord.
Lord,*spn hear my prayer; let*ln my cry for help come before you.
Do*ln not hide your face from me in my day of trouble. Listen*ln closely to me; answer*ln me quickly when I call.
For*pn my days vanish like smoke, and*ln my bones burn like a furnace.
My*ln heart is suffering, withered like grass; I*ln even forget to eat my food.
Because*ln of the sound of my groaning, my*ln flesh sticks to my bones.
I*ln am like an eagle owl, like*ln a little owl among the ruins.
I*ln stay awake; I*ln am like a solitary bird on a roof.
My*ln enemies taunt me all day long; they*ln ridicule and use my name as a curse.
I*ln eat ashes like bread and*ln mingle my drinks with tears
because*ln of your indignation and wrath; for*ln you have picked me up and thrown me aside.
My*ln days are like a lengthening shadow, and*ln I wither away like grass.
But*pn you, Lord,*s are enthroned forever; your*ln fame endures to all generations.
You*ln will rise up and have compassion on Zion, for*ln it is time to show favor to her — the*ln appointed time has come.
For*ln your servants take delight in its stones and*ln favor its dust.
Then*pn the nations will fear the name of the Lord,*s and*ln all the kings of the earth your glory,
for*ln the Lord*s will rebuild Zion; he*ln will appear in his glory.
He*ln will pay attention to the prayer of the destitute and*ln will not despise their prayer.
This*pn will be written for a later generation, and*ln a people who have not yet been created will praise the Lord:*s
He*ln looked down from his holy heights — the*ln Lord*s gazed out from heaven to earth—
to*ln hear a prisoner’s groaning, to*ln set free those condemned to die,
so*ln that they might declare the*ln name of the Lord*s in Zion and*ln his praise in Jerusalem
when*ln peoples and kingdoms are assembled to*ln serve the Lord.*s
He*pn has broken my strength in midcourse; he*ln has shortened my days.
I*ln say, “My God, do not take me in*ln the middle of my life! Your*ln years continue through all generations.
Long*ln ago you established the earth, and*ln the heavens are the work of your hands.
They*ln will perish, but you will endure; all*ln of them will wear out like clothing. You*ln will change them like a garment, and*ln they will pass away.
But*ln you are the same, and*ln your years will never end.
Your*ln servants’ children will dwell securely, and*ln their offspring will be established before you.”
